meta.project_name: Friends Places â€“ Social Recommendations MVP

objective: Deliver a mobile-first web app (SPA-like) where users can quickly save, view, and browse friends' recommended places, aligned with the Experience PROJECT_CONTEXT.
core_value_prop: Make it extremely easy to save a place you liked and let your friends discover it through a simple, trust-based social graph.
primary_use_cases: User visits or remembers a place and wants to save it in a few seconds via Quick Add Flow.
User opens the app to see a feed of places saved by friends.
User views their own profile and saved places (experiences + bookmarks).
User taps into a specific experience to see more details and open maps.

in_scope: Bottom navigation with core tabs: Feed, Add, Profile + Explore placeholder.
Quick Add Flow: location context, place search, optional enrichment, save.
Profile with experiences and bookmarks tab (bookmarks can be placeholder).
Integration with backend API for feed, add, profile, bookmarks.
out_of_scope_mvp: Offline-first complex PWA (basic PWA-friendly structure allowed).
Likes, comments, DMs, complex social/explore algorithms.
Complex theming system beyond provided design_tokens.

ux: User can add a place (Quick Add Flow) in ~15 seconds or less under normal network conditions.
Navigation between tabs is obvious and requires minimal taps.
Experience cards are readable and scannable on small screens.
Empty states clearly guide the user to next actions (e.g., follow friends, add a place).
technical: Frontend uses typed API clients and shared domain models with backend.
State management is simple and predictable (React Query or equivalent).
Basic accessibility is respected (focus management, touch targets, contrast).
Layout works well on common mobile breakpoints and desktop within a reasonable max width.
